title: Campaign to stop forced marriages in Sydney's airport bathrooms
text:
Airport bathrooms will be targeted as part of a new campaign to crackdown on predators who are forcing young girls overseas into arranged marriages.

Australian Federal Police and Anti-Slavery Australia have launched the initiative that will be rolled out in the bathrooms of the Sydney's domestic and international terminals from Tuesday.

'Bathrooms were chosen as the best place to display the information as they are ''often the only places in an airport that passengers at risk of being taken overseas for forced marriage may be on their own'', the AFP said in a statement.

Australian Federal Police and Anti-Slavery Australia have launched a campaign to be rolled out in Sydney's airport to help prevent women being taken for forced marriages

The campaign will include posters and digital screens detailing the illegality of forced marriages in Australia.

The bathrooms will also hold areas of support that will be available for the next six months.

'Supporting people in Australia who are at risk of forced marriages - particularly vulnerable teenagers - is crucial, as we recognise that disruption and deterrence can have a far-reaching and lasting impact in our communities,' AFP Assistant Commissioner Debbie Platz said.

The AFP defines a forced marriage as one without a person's free and full consent because they have been coerced, threatened or deceived.

The AFP said the number of forced marriages being referred to police has increased as awareness of the issue grows.

There were 91 reports in the 2018/19 financial year compared to just 11 in 2013/14, when forced marriages were officially made illegal under Commonwealth law.

Anti-Slavery Australia director Jill McKeough said connecting with the right support services in forced marriage scenarios was crucial in helping people escape situations of despair.

'It is vital that people get help before they are forced to go overseas for a marriage they don't want,' Ms McKeough said.

Some 44 million people pass through Sydney Airport each year.
